item.title: Command line applications in Go
item.description:
Command Line Interface (CLI) is usually a concise and powerful way to access application’s features. Let’s see how one can build a command line application using Go’s standard library.

Arguments / Positional parameters

Basic way of providing input to an application via command line is passing arguments or positional parameters.

var Args []string
    Args hold the command-line arguments, starting with the program name.
